resources.string: View asteroids for the next 7 days
The astronomical unit (au) is a unit of length, roughly the distance from Earth to the Sun and equal to about 150 million kilometres (93 million miles)
Click here to reveal the definition of an astronimical unit in a dialog.
An image of an asteroid covered in a re-entry fireball with an angry face superimposed that indicates that this asteroid could be hazardous.
An image of an asteroid with a happy face superimposed that indicates that this asteroid does not pose a danger.
This is NASA\'s picture of day, showing nothing yet
Oops! You seem to be offline and we don\'t seem to have any asteroids saved! Try connecting to the internet and hitting retry.
An asteroid list item with the code name %1$s, an approach date of %2$s and a smiley face that indicates it\'s %3$b that this asteroid is hazardous.
